amendment.description: An amendment numbered 22 printed in the Congressional Record to provide child care subsidies to the children of parents who are working or are enrolled in workforce activities, in a manner that does not put the child care needs of temporary residents ahead of families already on waiting lists for services funded by the Child Care and Development Fund, in any redistribution of unobligated Federal matching funds as authorized by section 418 of the Social Security Act, the Secretary of Health and Human Services shall give priority to States currently serving a significant number of children in families adversely affected by Hurricane Katrina.

action.text: Mr. Lewis (CA) raised a point of order against the Hall amendment (A031). Mr. Lewis (CA) raised a point of order against the amendment stating that it proposed to change existing law and constituted legislation in an appropriations bill. The Chair sustained the point of order.
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A031) offered by Mr. Hall.
